item.title: The Clap Button
item.description: I always loved the clap button from Medium because it allows people how much you actually like a post. So I just implemented that functionality for my blog.

item.title: Coronavirus Trend In Spain
item.description: After the video from Minute Earth about the coronavirus, I’ve decided to plot the same data but only for Spain by province. This gives a good view of which provinces are managing to stop the virus.

item.title: 2020-03-30 Weekend Learnings
item.description: I’ve learned a little bit about frontend testing with chromium web drivers using Agouti and It has proven to be a really good option to write test in Go. Also we are in quarantine so I let you here a WebGL interactive animation to entertain you.

item.title: Use Git to track Git versions
item.description: Everyone who has ever been involved in managing versions of different applications, knows that in can be a pain in the ass. Luckily enough there are tools to ease this work and I’ve found that Git provides a general solution independently of your technology stack. Git Submodules.

item.title: Ready to Go Auth server with Nginx
item.description: I got tired of seeing different implementations of authentication in different applications that tend to be insecure and hard to maintain. Usually, the best way to handle those situations is to delegate on someone with more experience like Google oauth2. But if you really need you own system… this approach should ease the work.

item.title: How to get bored
item.description: Being bored is really unpleasant and is considered as something to avoid for most of the people. In this post I want to show you why boredom can be something good and how you can take advantage of it.

item.title: 2019-12-22 Weekend Learnings
item.description: I understood how to use Go composition to extend the functionality similar to inheritance in OOP. I’ve used it before but now I can say that I understand it. Also, I’ve done a 3D model of the van that I’m going to use for the moving in January. Just to know if I can fit everything inside.

item.title: 2019-12-15 Weekend Learnings
item.description: I’ve been using VSCode as my principal editor for a while now, and it keeps improving in every release with things that I cannot believe. Last was remote containers. Today is….(drums)… Live Share!

item.title: 2019-12-09 Weekend Learnings
item.description: I discovered that Go supports build to Web Assembly. What a great time to be alive. Also I’ve spent some time changing the favicon of this blog and finished the post about Python Jupyter notebook with Plotly

item.title: Python Jupyter Notebook With Plotly Support
item.description: Python is awesome because you can do anything. In this case, I’m going to show you how to configure a Jupyter notebook with integrated Plotly support to draw interactive graphs. This is very useful if you have to analyse something.

item.title: Add Plots With Hugo Shortcodes - Plotly
item.description: Plotly is my favourite tool to create plots for a lot of reasons. One is that you can create plots with javascript and create interactive graphs. I’m going to show you how to create a shortcode to add plots to your hugo static site.

item.title: 2019-12-02 Weekend Learnings
item.description: I managed to send audio to my Google Home, discovered the Go tool trace and started a post about Python and Jupyter.

item.title: Avoid Github Government Block
